urls.title: COVID-19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - second update
urls.description: The aim of this document is to provide an update on the knowledge surrounding the role of children in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the role of schools in the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing in particular on the experience in EU/EEA countries since the beginning of the pandemic. This document also addresses transmission to and from staff in school settings, school-related mitigation measures including risk communication, testing, contact tracing, and the effectiveness and impacts of school closures.

tweets.text:
#JustPublished:
#COVID19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - first update!

Our report on kids and COVID-19 has been updated based on most recent knowledge and.

See it full here: https://t.co/sPRji6xlXb https://t.co/HsFsttcCmi

There is a general consensus that closing schools to control #COVID19 pandemic should be used as a last resort.

The negative physical, mental health & educational impact of proactive school closures on children & the economic impact on society would likely outweigh the benefits. https://t.co/3yRejuTgeC

Educational staff and adults within the school setting are not seen to be at a higher risk of infection than other occupations, although educational roles that put one in contact with older children and/or many adults may be associated with a higher risk.

https://t.co/sPRji6xlXb

#NPIs in schools - #PhysicalDistancing preventing crowding, #hygiene & safety measures are essential to preventing transmission.

#COVID19 vaccination and prioritisation strategies in the EU/EEA.

By using mathematical modelling, this document provides EU/EEA countries with information on factors that may affect the choice of COVID-19 #vaccination.

Read full: https://t.co/Fh0qiE1At6 https://t.co/qCmhDLdFN7

Now that the first #vaccine has been authorised for use, #ECDC provides a framework for Member States to assist in prioritisation strategies for optimal health outcomes.

Read the full news article: https://t.co/x7z8q97V1N https://t.co/CaXyaedQ2b

The choice of #vaccination strategy depends on the objective: reducing mortality, saving life years or reducing healthcare system pressure.

The prioritisation also depends on the characteristics of the vaccine - e.x. its efficacy against infection.

https://t.co/Fh0qiE1At6

#ECDC welcomes the authorisation of the first #vaccine against #COVID19 in EU/EEA.

#ECDC Director Andrea Ammon is taking part in the @GLOBSEC Virtual Health side event: Restoring the Value of #Vaccines today.

‚ÄûWe need the healthcare professionals to be the champions of vaccination to raise vaccine confidence.‚Äù https://t.co/1i3h8bYFAG

There are lots of challenges with #COVID19 data. #Surveillance is the backbone of prevention and control of the infectious diseases.

Data you get depend on the system you design. Before you design the system you need to know what you want to do with the data.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/DdCbW7nHGS

For winter we need to monitor other respiratory diseases, especially #influenza.

We need a proper protocol to get the data in the system ‚Äì to set capable monitoring of #COVID19 and #flu. It is important to have it uniform in all MS to have informed political decisions.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/AX4ok08QY4

#JustPublished!
5th update of the infection prevention and control (#IPC) and preparedness for #COVID19 in healthcare settings.

Find the report here: https://t.co/rnVqRSWrCA https://t.co/YK3IxLFnwv

‚Äû#Vaccine development is highly complex and usually takes around 10 years, but the @EU_Commission & EU agencies are making every effort to ensure that EU citizens can access the vaccine once proven to be ready for approval and use in our vaccination programmes‚Äù.

#GLOBSEC2020 https://t.co/4KfyeTdz43

‚Äû(...) A vaccine will not automatically lead to the end of the pandemic. As vaccines start to be deployed, other measures to control the pandemic will still need to continue to be in place for some time.‚Äù - Andrea #Ammon at #GLOBSEC2020 https://t.co/nUj6DT8VC4

‚ÄûIt happens also with existing vaccines, the public faces a real challenge in sifting scientific facts from fiction and understanding which information to trust and which to ignore.

In addition, we also need to address the expectations of people regarding the new vaccine (...)‚Äù https://t.co/enyxITy8y5

‚ÄûWe also see that #misinformation and #disinformation around a not-yet available vaccine is circulating in the internet and social media.

This can contribute to the uncertainty and affect the public‚Äôs trust in a future vaccine‚Äù.

#GLOBSEC2020 #VaccinesSaveLives #EVIP #COVID19 https://t.co/9RsGGsAthi

‚ÄûBut one of the challenges we face regarding the introduction of a new vaccine is trust.

A lack of confidence in the new vaccine can undermine the expectations that it will help to curb the pandemic‚Äù - #ECDC Director Andrea #Ammon at #GLOBSEC2020 https://t.co/2w2DSbaIMK

‚ÄûWith the lives lost during the #COVID19 pandemic and the devastating socio-economic consequences across the world, high hopes are placed on the availability ‚Äì sooner than later ‚Äì of a safe and effective vaccine that can hopefully contribute to address the pandemic‚Äù

#GLOBSEC2020 https://t.co/P49t9yKBbh

For this to be successful, we have to ensure continuous commitment from all of us and make sure that our efforts are fit for purpose". https://t.co/aXfwbjKhcK
